description:
All marital relationships will inevitably have conflict. The biggest difference between those marriages which make it through rough waters and those which do not is the ability to communicate constructively. This course will cover helpful communication skills that can help couples, communities, and other groups resolve interpersonal conflicts. Students will learn seven principles of conflict resolution including how to listen and respond effectively, how to carefully consider the other person's perspective, and how to better manage emotions.

Intended for a variety of audiences, this course is taught by Dr. Greg Kolodziejczak. Students will gain an appreciation of psychological principles involved in communication and conflict resolution and strategies to improve their own communication skills. This course is perfect for those who want to form more meaningful relationships with others.
title: Conflict Resolution in Marriages, Families and Communities
